text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with peanut dipping sauce that's
right this is the new improved peanut
sauce recipe that you saw featured on
our beef satay video i promise i show
you how to make it and you know what
that's just what i'm about to do so
we're going to start in a mixing bowl
with some peanut butter and i'm not
using those name brands that are all
chuck full of the mullah fires and
stabilizers and sweeteners and all that
kind of stuff we are using pure
all-natural hippie style peanut butter
which is just made from peanuts and a
little bit of salt by the way if you do
use those name brands you will have to
adjust the sugar in this recipe so heads
up but anyway we're going to need some
what they call natural style peanut
butter to that I'm gonna add some very
very finely minced garlic I'm also going
to dump in some brown sugar and I really
should have broke that up because now
you know the exact shape of my measuring
spoons we're also going to add a splash
of fish sauce and some soy sauce and a
little bit of sesame oil which may seem
a little redundant with the peanut
butter
but it's definitely not and very
important in this and then to balance
all that richness we need to put in some
freshly squeezed lime juice and then
almost last but not least a little bit
of hot sauce I'm using sriracha but you
can use anything you want including but
not limited to cayenne pepper and then
I'm just going to let that sit there
like that no need to mix it yet because
what we're going to do next is heat up
the last and not so secret ingredient
coconut milk so I want to pour a small
can of coconut milk into a small
saucepan place that over medium heat and
as soon as that starts to simmer we're
going to pour it over the rest of the
ingredients and that hot coconut milk is
not only going to thin out the sauce but
that heats going to help wake up all the
flavors and meld everything together and
as soon as that's incorporated your
peanut sauce is pretty much done and yes
of course you're going to taste and
adjust this is absolutely one of those
recipes you're going to have to adjust
to your palate you might need a little
more acid a little more soy or fish
sauce for some salt you may want to
spice it up a little more alright so
consider this a base consider this a
template that you can then tailor to
your personal tastes and once you have
tasted and adjusted you're ready to
serve and you can totally slop it on
just like this but what we like to do
around here is pretty it up a little bit
so I'm going to add a little bit of
diced hot red chilies maybe some chopped
cilantro and definitely definitely some
chopped peanuts and that is now fully
garnished and ready to present to your
guests so I know we did have a
previously posted peanut sauce recipe
but I do prefer this new method new
formula and you can see that gorgeous
luxurious texture and as good as it
tastes on that freakishly small metal
spoon it's pretty much fantastic on any
grilled meat also a perfect dipping
sauce for spring rolls and if you swing
that way you can even use this as a
sauce for grilled vegetables so anyway I
really do hope you give this new and
improved peanut dipping sauce recipe a
try head over to food wishes comm for
all the ingredient amounts and more info
as usual and as always enjoy
